title: Hollywood’s Enduring Fascination with Ancient Rome
subtitle: The allure of ancient Rome remains irresistible for filmmakers, offering a potent blend of grandeur, intrigue, and decadence. With its capricious rulers, dramatic politics, and penchant for bloodsport, Rome provides a narrative canvas rich in historical significance and sensationalist potential. For Hollywood, this setting serves as both an educational backdrop and an excuse to push the boundaries of storytelling, blending scholarship with spectacle to captivate audiences across generations.
author: 侯 默

title: “美国优先”的世界：特朗普回归可能对全球秩序的深远影响
subtitle: 如果美国不再视自身为全球秩序的核心塑造者，而是逐渐回归普通大国的角色，世界将会如何变化？这一假设并非全然虚构，而是基于一种可能性：美国外交政策彻底放弃多边主义和全球责任转而关注短期的国家利益最大化。
author: DailyPolitics

title: Do the results of elections express the will of the people?
subtitle: Every two years, Americans go to the polls to elect their representatives. There are myriad traditions which accompany elections in the United States, one of which is to vociferously criticize the outcomes of those elections. Whether this manifests in Democrats frustrated with their inability to capture state legislatures (as in Wisconsin), or Republicans frustrated with their inability to win state-wide offices (as in California), such criticism of election results stems from a concern that elections do not represent the will of the people. These concerns, present not only in the US but also in nearly all countries using elections to put politicians into government offices, are understandable because, as this essay will argue, the results of democratic elections, regardless of electoral procedures, do not actually represent the will of the people. The results of elections always grant certain groups more representation while overlooking or minimizing the preferences of others. This essay will examine the theoretical tradition of elections and provide empirical examples of how election results do not represent the will of the people.
author: Qinhe

title: 关于美国最高法院
subtitle: 美国最高法院是美国最高级别的联邦法院，也是美国三权继总统、国会后最为重要的一环。最高法院拥有很大的司法权力，通常是包括《美国宪法》在内的联邦法律的最终解释者，但仅在具有管辖权的案件范围内：例如最高法院并不享有判定政治问题的权力。
author: DailyPolitics

title: Book Review: Mimura's Planning for Empire
subtitle: Mimura opens a nuanced debate about the ideological motivations behind Japan’s expansionist policies, especially in the context of the global spread of technocratic ideas during the early twentieth century.
author: 侯 默

title: Is there such a thing as too much democracy?
subtitle: At a rally in Michigan, Donald Trump proclaimed to his supporters that, as a true man of the people, if he were to lose the 2024 presidential election, then American democracy would be dead.
author: Qinhe

title: US Elections Prediction
subtitle: While I do have my political views on this election, this article aims to remain nonpartisan. It focuses on predicting the election one day ahead, using recent insights that may be less widely known.
author: 侯 默

title: On Right-Wing Propaganda
subtitle: From the earliest forms, far-right movements utilized propaganda to spread their ideals, whether in power or not. These propagandas can be positive, presenting the far-right movement as benign and helping the nation, or negative, vilifying opponents of the movement. As technology progressed, propaganda had also taken various forms. This essay examines the key forms of propaganda the far-right used and its purposes by evaluating the use of propaganda by right-wing movements in three drastically different contexts- late 19th century France, imperial Japan, and Fascist Italy.
author: 侯 默

title: Why do civilisations collapse? Is our civilisation in danger?
subtitle: Scholars have proposed myriad reasons for the collapse of civilisations, such as environmental deterioration (Diamond, 2005) and a lack of social welfare (Good and Reuveny, 2009). However, most agree that human actions, particularly governmental failures, play a role. As this essay will argue, a collapse of governance can be largely attributed to insufficient democratisation of governing systems, a problem which inevitably leads to internal government malfunctions.
author: Qinhe

title: Book Review: Black Skin, White Masks
subtitle: This is a review of: Fanon, Frantz. Black Skin, White Masks. Social theory re-wired. Routledge, 2023. 355-361.
author: Qinhe

title: The Paradox of Leisure in the Age of AI
subtitle: Leisure, in many economic models, acts as a counterbalance to labor, offering a measure of the intangible values that contribute to societal and individual happiness. John Maynard Keynes (1930) predicted an 'age of leisure,' where technology would surpass human productivity, freeing individuals to pursue personal interests. As artificial intelligence continues to transform the labor market and gradually outperform human productivity, attracting employers, the arrival of the era of immense productivity that Keynes spoke of seems almost within reach. However, a growing body of evidence suggests that the rapid proliferation of AI may paradoxically infringe upon leisure in the short term rather than augment it. By identifying these potential threats to leisure in the AI era, this paper endeavors to provide valuable insights to optimize the deployment of artificial intelligence in a way that genuinely augments human leisure and well-being, instead of inadvertently diminishing it.
author: 侯 默
